image.altText: Man holding a long gun in front of pink building.

props.synopsis: The suspect allegedly forced a pub patron to drive him almost 300 kilometres before he was apprehended by police.

title.children: CCTV shows outback pub kidnapping suspect throw pair of firearms down before arrest

image.altText: A teenage boy in a white hoodie and black baseball cap

props.synopsis: The prosecution argued the four co-accused had formed a "common purpose" to kill Kingsley Alley in the early hours of October 8, 2022, while the defence accused prosecutors of "cherry-picking" evidence.Â

title.children: Murder trial of four people accused of killing 18-year-old in Darwin driveway hears closing arguments

image.altText: two chinese men standing next to each other with their faces blurred

props.synopsis: An Indigenous ranger group that rescued four asylum seekers on a remote island off the Northern Territory coast last week is calling for the federal government to guarantee their safety.

title.children: 'He said if he's sent back to China, he'll be killed': Rangers question future of asylum seekers found in remote NT

image.altText: Anzac Oval

props.synopsis: Alice Springs residents are beginning to doubt a controversial plan to construct an Aboriginal art gallery will go ahead after the Northern Territory government revealed its intention to almost halve the building's size.

title.children: 'Hopeless fiasco' of Alice Springs art gallery plan continues as NT government drastically alters building size

image.altText: Copper wiring bundles into circles

props.synopsis: NT Police say thieves have been targeting telecommunication pits in Alice Springs in recent months, using "large vehicles" to pull out hundreds of metres of copper wire.

title.children: Thieves strip Alice Springs telco pits of 'tens of thousands of dollars' worth of copper wire, disrupting services

image.altText: A man wearing glasses and a blue shirt standing in front of a GP clinic.

props.synopsis: A spike in doctors training in general practice will end a seven-year decline, but rural communities fear it won't stem a chronic healthcare shortage.

title.children: Trainee GP numbers will increase by 20 per cent next year and rural communities are begging them to stay

image.altText: The outside of the NAAJA building in Darwin.

props.synopsis: One of Australia's top Aboriginal legal services, NAAJA, has publicly apologised for the unlawful sacking of former chief executive officer Priscilla Atkins.

title.children: Aboriginal legal service NAAJA apologises for 'hurt' caused by unlawful sacking of CEO

image.altText: Golden Snapper stocks near Darwin are declining rapidly.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory is famous for its fishing, but one iconic species is under threat. The government says tough decisions will need to be made.

title.children: 'Tough decisions' needed to save popular fish in the Top End

image.altText: A silhouette of a pregnant woman outside.

props.synopsis: A new report shows only 6 per cent of child protection funding goes to Aboriginal-run organisations, despite these groups often posting better outcomes.Â

title.children: First Nations children are being removed from families at highest levels ever recorded

image.altText: Snake head close up flicking its tongue

props.synopsis: Passengers are met with bizarre scenes as a television personality wrangles a snake onboard a plane in Western Australia's north.

title.children: Reality TV personality wrangles snake on a plane, delaying Virgin flight

image.altText: A man in a grey black suit and glasses smiles for a photo

props.synopsis: In a statement, the mining company confirmed "all three employees are safe and well and have departed the country".

title.children: Resolute Mining CEO and two other executives released by Mali government

image.altText: SYDNEY TRAINS INDUSTRIAL ACTION STOCK

props.synopsis: Premier Chris Minns said the government has agreed to run as many 24-hour train services as possible this weekend and intensive negotiations with the rail union will be held over the next two weeks to hammer out a long-term deal.

title.children: Sydney's rail strike called off after NSW government reaches 11th-hour deal with union

image.altText: A man it a suit sits behind a microphone in a council chamber

props.synopsis: The embattled mayor was the subject of an ongoing Crime and Corruption Commission investigation.

title.children: Townsville mayor suspended on $225,000 salary amid probe into whether he misrepresented his military history

image.altText: A woman stands next to a large painting of herself dressed in a yellow gown and feather boa

props.synopsis: Broken Hill local June Marie Bennett, who played Shirl in The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert, is remembered by friends and family as "a born performer" with an "incredible love for life".

title.children: Outback icon known for role in cult classic Priscilla, Queen of the Desert dies aged 85

image.altText: Ben Camporeale and Lucas Camporeale

props.synopsis: The second night of the 2024 AFL draft is full of intrigue and opportunity, with clubs eyeing potential steals and sliders lower down the order. See every pick made on night two.

title.children: Dreams turn to reality as Blues land both Camporeale twins â see every pick taken on night two of AFL draft

image.altText: A wide shot of the UN Security council meeting in a circle at its headquarters.

props.synopsis: The United States vetoes a UN Security Council resolution for a ceasefire in Gaza, drawing criticism of the Biden administration for again blocking international action aimed at halting Israel's war with Hamas.

title.children: US vetoes Gaza ceasefire resolution as Hamas rules out hostage deal until war ends

image.altText: Man in suit speaks at podium

props.synopsis: Gautam Adani, the Indian billionaire behind Queensland's controversial Carmichael coal project, is charged in the US over an alleged multi-billion-dollar fraud scheme.

title.children: US authorities issue arrest warrant for Adani boss

image.altText: A court sketch of a woman with dark skin in a suit wearing handcuffs.

props.synopsis: A Perth grandmother who claims a love scammer tricked her into taking two kilograms of methamphetamine into Japan has told a court she had met romantic interests overseas before.

title.children: Accused Perth drug smuggler travelled overseas to meet other romantic interests before alleged Japan 'love scam', trial told

image.altText: A baby sits against a white background smiling wearing a white shirt and flowery pants

props.synopsis: An inquest has heard that a father who killed his baby daughter in a murder-suicide near the Barossa, north of Adelaide, manipulated his ex-partner to drop domestic violence charges by deceiving the prison he was being held in.

title.children: Man who killed baby daughter in murder-suicide deceived a prison to manipulate his ex-partner

image.altText: Protesters gathered on the shores of Newcastle Harbour while a flotilla of vessels converged on the water.

props.synopsis: In an operation planned for well over a month, protesters took to Newcastle Harbour as a large bulk carrier entered the vital export port.

title.children: Protesters remain on water despite bulk carrier entering world's largest coal port

image.altText: Professor Richard Scolyer smiles, wearing a collared shirt and black jacket

props.synopsis: After 18 months and 14 doses of revolutionary experimental treatment, Australian of the Year Richard Scolyer gives an update on his latest brain scan, cautioning that these results "could just be luck".

title.children: 'Blown away I'm still here': Richard Scolyer still cancer-free 18 months into revolutionary treatment

image.altText: A black and white image of Lazar competing in the games 2023.

props.synopsis: The investigation into Lazar ÃukiÄ's drowning at this year's CrossFit Games is complete, but the organisation is criticised for not releasing the full report.

title.children: CrossFit criticised for not releasing full investigation into Lazar ÃukiÄ's drowning at 2024 Games

image.altText: A composite image of three people

props.synopsis: Four days before the start of a scheduled trial, prosecutors drop manslaughter charges over a boat crash south of Perth that killed two women, including the mother of West Coast Eagles footballer Rhett Bazzo.

title.children: Lawyer hits out at police after manslaughter charges dropped over boat crash that killed mother of AFL player

image.altText: Man holding a long gun in front of pink building.

props.synopsis: The suspect allegedly forced a pub patron to drive him almost 300 kilometres before he was apprehended by police.

title.children: CCTV shows outback pub kidnapping suspect throw pair of firearms down before arrest

image.altText: Namila Benson, with flowing black dress and bright auburn hair, smiles widely surrounded by shrubs and a path.

props.synopsis: On Thursday, the ABC announced its content slate for 2025, across broadcast and digital platforms, including six arts series.

title.children: ABC announces broadcasting plans for 2025 with focus on the arts

image.altText: An illustration shows a pregnant woman sitting cross-legged while a woman with halo leans down to touch her belly

props.synopsis: They check the baby's position and listen to the heartbeat, but they aren't qualified midwives. Parents say a "dangerous" new breed of birth worker has emerged to fill the gap for women wanting to birth outside hospital.

title.children: 'Sovereign midwife' who thought baby's shoulder was a head linked to three baby deaths

image.altText: Donald Trump looks sideways while standing at a podium

props.synopsis: The next eight weeks leading up to Donald Trump's January 20 inauguration will be both dangerous and decisive in terms of the future of the Ukraine war.

title.children: This could be the final phase of the Ukraine war â and we're starting to see the 'Trump factor' kick in

image.altText: Australian twenty dollar bills

props.synopsis: The federal government's decision to have the fund invest in housing and green energy has ruffled Coalition feathers.

title.children: The Future Fund is Australia's rainy day fund. It has now become a political football

image.altText: White split toed shoes.

props.synopsis: Inspired by footwear worn by construction workers in Japan, tabi shoes are turning heads from Hollywood to Melbourne. What makes them so special?

title.children: The tradie footwear from Japan selling for $1,500 and seen on catwalks everywhere

image.altText: Lava is thrown into the air, on a dark background

props.synopsis: A volcano near Iceland's capital has erupted for the seventh time in a year, spewing fountains of lava and smoke.

title.children: Volcano on Iceland's Reykjanes Peninsula erupts for the seventh time in a year

image.altText: A man in a wheelchair protests with others holding signs

props.synopsis: Adam Quarrell says being an NDIS participant is like "being in an abusive relationship". He's fighting to have funding restored in his care plan for catheters, without which he says he will die.

title.children: 'I'm not inserting catheters for fun, mate': NDIS participant's fight for funding leaves him furious

image.altText: A large tree stump smashes through the front of a car windscreen with tree branches scattered on the bonnet

props.synopsis: Residents says the storm lasted less than 15 minutes, but the clean-up from the damage is expected to take days.

title.children: Clean-up underway after severe, damaging storm hits mining town of Tom Price

image.altText: The corporate logo of Google Chrome reproduced on a white wall.

props.synopsis: The move is one of the most aggressive attempts by the Biden administration to curb what it alleges are Big Tech monopolies.

title.children: US Justice Department asks judge to force Google to sell Chrome internet browser

image.altText: A man speaking into a microphone, seen from close up

props.synopsis: Billionaires are playing an increasing role in US politics, and while some are very visible, several legal rulings have paved the way for other mega-wealthy donors to splash their cash and cover their tracks.

title.children: 'Broligarchs' now run the US, and their dark money is hard to trace

image.altText: banana duct taped to a white wall

props.synopsis: A piece of conceptual art consisting of a banana duct-taped to a wall has sold for $US6.2 million ($9.57 million) at an auction in New York.

title.children: Banana taped to wall sells for nearly $10 million at auction
